intro: Euodia eriophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring. Its hard, woody structure makes it a resilient shrub or small tree, often found in rocky or arid environments. The plant's aromatic properties and ornamental value make it a notable species in its native habitat.
